title: Mark Truscott
text:
Mark Truscott (born 1970) is a <a href="Toronto">Toronto</a> poet. He was born in <a href="Bloomington%2C%20Indiana">Bloomington</a>, <a href="Indiana">Indiana</a>, United States. He attended several public schools and <a href="Nelson%20High%20School%20%28Ontario%29">Nelson High School</a> in <a href="Burlington%2C%20Ontario">Burlington, Ontario</a> and went on for a B.A. and M.A. in English at <a href="McMaster%20University">McMaster University</a> in Hamilton.
His first collection, "Said Like Reeds or Things" (<a href="Coach%20House%20Books">Coach House Books</a>, 2004), was shortlisted for a <a href="ReLit%20Award">ReLit Award</a> and received an <a href="Alcuin%20Society%20Book%20Design%20Awards">Alcuin Society Book Design Awards</a> citation for <a href="Darren%20Wershler-Henry">Darren Wershler-Henry</a>’s design. His third collection, "Branches," won the inaugural Nelson Ball Prize. Poems appear in the anthologies "Shift & Switch: New Canadian Poetry" (Mercury Press, 2005) and "Pissing Ice: An Anthology of 'New' Canadian Poets" (BookThug, 2004). He co-edited the small magazine "BafterC" with Jay MillAr and curated the Test Reading Series.
